content:
Diagnosis:		Malignant pleural mesothelioma, BAP1 negative, Stage IIIB

Management:		Completed 6 cycles carboplatin/pemetrexed March-August 2023
		Pleural drain insertion right chest July 2023

Current situation:	Routine follow-up post chemotherapy

[redacted name] attended clinic today for routine follow-up. CT thorax performed last week shows stable disease with no significant interval change in pleural thickening or pericardial involvement. His breathlessness remains stable, managing daily activities with minimal limitations. Performance status remains 1. No new symptoms reported. Weight stable at 72kg.

Bloods show stable picture with normal renal and liver function. Latest LDH 245.

Plan is to continue surveillance with 3-monthly CT scans. Next review arranged for April 2024 with imaging. Patient aware to contact if any deterioration in symptoms before then.
